pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people wearing sandals. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:7.2: “‘I will not give teachings to anyone wearing sandals who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:8.1: One should not give teachings to anyone wearing sandals who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:8.2: If a monk out of disrespect gives teachings to someone who is not sick and who is standing on sandals, whose sandals are fastened, or whose sandals are loose, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:9.2: if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:9.3: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk62:10.1: The second training rule is finished.
